string-array.name: luxor_attrations1
string-array.item: The Karnak Temple Complex, commonly known as Karnak, comprises a vast mix of decayed temples, chapels, pylons, and other buildings.

string-array.name: luxor_attrations2
string-array.item: The Valley of the Kings, the Valley of the Gates of the Kings, is a valley in Egypt where, for a period of nearly 500 years from the 16th to 11th century BC.

string-array.name: luxor_attrations3
string-array.item: The Colossi of Memnon are two massive stone statues of the Pharaoh Amenhotep III, who reigned in Egypt during Dynasty XVIII.

string-array.name: luxor_attrations4
string-array.item: The Valley of the Queens is a place in Egypt where wives of Pharaohs were buried in ancient times. In ancient times, it was known as Ta-Set-Neferu, meaning –"the place of beauty".

string-array.name: luxor_attrations5
string-array.item: The Mortuary Temple of Ramesses III at Medinet Habu is an important New Kingdom period structure in the West Bank of Luxor in Egypt.

string-array.name: Aswan_attrations1
string-array.item: Philae is currently an island in the reservoir of the Aswan Low Dam downstream of the Aswan Dam and Lake Nasser, Egypt.

string-array.name: Aswan_attrations2
string-array.item: The unfinished obelisk is the largest known ancient obelisk and is located in the northern region of the stone quarries of ancient Egypt in Aswan, Egypt.

string-array.name: Aswan_attrations3
string-array.item: The Nubian Museum is an archaeological museum located in Aswan, Upper Egypt. It was built to a design by architect Mahmoud El-Hakim.

string-array.name: Aswan_attrations4
string-array.item: Elephantine is an island on the Nile, forming part of the city of Aswan in southern Egypt. There are archaeological sites on the island.

string-array.name: Aswan_attrations5
string-array.item: The Temple of Kom Ombo is an unusual double temple in the town of Kom Ombo in Aswan Governorate, Upper Egypt.

string-array.name: Alex_attrations1
string-array.item: Montaza Palace is a palace and extensive gardens in the Montaza district of Alexandria, Egypt.

string-array.name: Alex_attrations2
string-array.item: The Citadel of Qaitbay is a 15th-century defensive fortress located on the Mediterranean sea coast, in Alexandria, Egypt.

string-array.name: Alex_attrations3
string-array.item: The Lighthouse of Alexandria, sometimes called the Pharos of Alexandria, was a lighthouse built by the Ptolemaic Kingdom

string-array.name: Alex_attrations4
string-array.item: Montaza Palace is a palace and extensive gardens in the Montaza district of Alexandria, Egypt.

string-array.name: Alex_attrations5
string-array.item: St. Takla Haymanots Church is a Coptic Orthodox church in the city of Alexandria, Egypt,

string-array.name: Cairo_attrations1
string-array.item: Khan elKhalili is a major souk in the Islamic district of Cairo. The bazaar district is one of Cairos main attractions for tourists and Egyptians alike.

string-array.name: Cairo_attrations2
string-array.item: The Giza pyramid complex is an archaeological site on the Giza Plateau, on the outskirts of Cairo, Egypt.

string-array.name: Cairo_attrations3
string-array.item: Saint Virgin Marys Coptic Orthodox Church also known as the Hanging Church is one of the oldest churches in Egypt

string-array.name: Cairo_attrations4
string-array.item: Islamic Cairo is a part of central Cairo noted for its historically important mosques and other Islamic monuments.

string-array.name: Cairo_attrations5
string-array.item: The Ben Ezra Synagogue, sometimes referred to as the El-Geniza Synagogue or the Synagogue of the Levantines, is situated in Old Cairo,
